sen.j: 小野 毛人（おの の えみし、生年不詳 - 677年）は、飛鳥時代の官僚。
sen.e: ONO no Emishi (year of birth unknown - 677) was a government official who lived during the Asuka period.

sen.j: 毛人の経歴の詳細については不詳であるが、天武天皇朝の元で太政官をつとめ、刑部大卿を兼務していた。
sen.e: The details of Emishi's career are unknown, but he served as a member of Daijokan (Grand Council of State) and Minister of Justice during the reign of the Emperor Tenmu.
sen.cmt: 「太政官をつとめ」→「太政官の一員であった」と解釈しました。「刑部大卿」→刑部卿 (Minister of Justice) と解釈しました。
sen.e: The details of Emishi's career are unknown, but it is known that he served as a member of Dajokan (Grand Council of State) and held an additional post as the Minister of Justice during the reign of the Emperor Tenmu.
sen.cmt: Daijokan→Dajokan「兼務していた」が欠けていましたので追加しました。
sen.e: The details of Emishi's career are unknown, but it is known that he served as a member of Dajokan (Grand Council of State) and held an additional post as the Minister of Justice during the reign of the Emperor Tenmu.

sen.j: 江戸時代初期に現在の京都府京都市左京区上高野にある崇道神社近くの山から毛人の墓誌が発見され、現在国宝に指定されている。
sen.e: In the early Edo period, the epitaph of Emishi was discovered in a mountain near Sudo-jinja Shrine, now in Kamitakano, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, and is currently designated as National Treasure.
